intro: Piriqueta tracyi, commonly known as Tracy's piriqueta, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged opposite each other along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
